conclusion: Need to calculate the distance fallen between t = 10s and t = 15s.
Distance traveled is equal to the area under the velocity-time curve for the given time interval.
At t = 10s, the velocity is 20 m/s and decreases linearly to 10 m/s at t = 15s.
Calculate the area under the curve as a trapezoid: Area = (1/2) × 5s × (20 m/s + 10 m/s) = 75 m.
Since the calculated distance is exactly 75 meters, it is not greater than 75 meters.
The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is exactly 75 meters, so it is not greater than 75 meters.
